title: caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-gcc4.8 cannot be found
body_html:
While trying to install caffe2 (just typing: conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-gcc4.8)
I got the following error:

Solving environment: failed

PackagesNotFoundError: The following packages are not available from current channels:

  • caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-gcc4.8

Current channels:

  • https://conda.anaconda.org/caffe2/linux-64
  • https://conda.anaconda.org/caffe2/noarch
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/linux-64
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/noarch
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/linux-64
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/noarch
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/linux-64
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/noarch
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/linux-64
  • https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/noarch

indeed wile looking in these channels (look for example: https://conda.anaconda.org/caffe2/linux-64) I couldn't see the -gcc-4.8 files (it exist only for a cpu installation).

I'm using:

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • How you installed PyTorch: conda
  • Python version: 2.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda9.0, cudnn7
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 4.8.5

Thanks

body:
While trying to install caffe2 (just typing: conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-gcc4.8)
I got the following error:

Solving environment: failed

PackagesNotFoundError: The following packages are not available from current channels:

  - caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-gcc4.8

Current channels:

  - https://conda.anaconda.org/caffe2/linux-64
  - https://conda.anaconda.org/caffe2/noarch
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/linux-64
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/noarch
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/linux-64
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/noarch
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/linux-64
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/noarch
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/linux-64
  - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/noarch

indeed wile looking in these channels (look for example: https://conda.anaconda.org/caffe2/linux-64) I couldn't see the -gcc-4.8 files (it exist only for a cpu installation).

I'm using:

- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
- How you installed PyTorch: conda
- 
- Python version: 2.7
- CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda9.0, cudnn7
-
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 4.8.5
- 
Thanks
